intro: Vincetoxicum dalatense, commonly known as the Dalat beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking clusters of purple to blue berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense inflorescences, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The berries are toxic to humans and animals, making it an important plant in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
